newsitem.title: ESTONIA: MOST TALLINN CITY FIRMS MADE PROFIT.
newsitem.headline: MOST TALLINN CITY FIRMS MADE PROFIT.

text.p: A total 38 Tallinn municipal companies made a profit last year while 16 ended the year in red, the city government said on Friday.
The council owns heating, transport, lighting and various maintenance companies.

Municipal companies had a net profit of 126.9 million kroons in total, mostly accounted for by the 112 million kroon profit of the Tallinn Water and Sewage Company, vice-mayor, Ants Leemets, told a news conference.
Tallinn Water and Sewage is to be privatised and floated on the stock market.
Tallinn city government decided on Friday to take two million kroons of the total profit into the Tallinn budget.
